III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (2) An agency will provide a list of these prohibited practices to all
Description youth, their families, and referring agencies upon admission.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation At the beginning of March 2023, Youth A grabbed a Staff
member's purse off the counter and broke the strap. Staff member
grabbed Youth A by the arms, put youth against the wall, and
used inappropriate language.
Investigation This complaint was assigned on 03/27/2023 and investigated in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist.
The complainant was anonymous; therefore, not interviewed.
I interviewed Consumer Rights Officer at the facility on
03/28/2023, in collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Consumer
Rights Officer reported, there was an incident on 03/11/2023 that
involved Staff 1 and Youth B, but there have been no incidents
involving Youth A. Video footage of the incident was reviewed, he
observed Youth B grabbing Staff 1’s purse off the desk, Staff 1
walks toward Youth B grab the purse strap, and the strap break.
He said at no point does staff grab Youth B. or put her against the
wall. Consumer Rights Officer reported Staff 1 is a Team Leader
and is by the book, so he is not sure why someone would make
this complaint. He said Staff 1 has no disciplinary reports. He said
an incident report was not completed, because Youth A was being
playful, and nothing happened to the youth. Consumer Rights Officer
said the facility does have lockers for staff to use for their personal
belongings, and staff are encouraged to lock their personal
belongings.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 03/28/2023, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Youth A has been at the facility for 5 months
and is on Wing A. Youth A denied any issues or incidents involving
Staff 1. Youth A seemed puzzled and confused when questioned
about the incident. Youth A reported she has never been pushed or
grabbed by any staff at the facility. She expressed no concerns
regarding staff or the facility.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 03/28/2023, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Youth B has been at the facility for 3 months
and she is on Wing B. Youth B admitted that she was playing around
with Staff 1 and grabbed her purse off the desk. She and Staff 1 were
2

playing Monopoly and Staff 1 put the Monopoly money in her purse,
so she grabbed Staff 1’s purse. Staff 1 attempted to take the purse
back, grabbed the strap and the strap broke. Youth B said she
apologized to Staff 1 and when she tried to give Staff 1 a hug, Staff1
put her hand up and told Youth B to leave her alone. Youth B said
Staff 1 was upset, but she denied Staff 1 grabbed and pushed her
against the wall. Youth B denied Staff 1 used inappropriate language
or said she did not care if there are cameras.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 03/28/2023, in collaboration with
DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 has been working at the facility for 6 years
and is Team Leader. Staff 1 reported that a few weeks ago she and
Youth B were playing a game and she had her purse on the desk.
She said Youth B grabbed her purse and walked away. Staff 1
followed Youth B and attempted to grab the purse back resulting in
the strap breaking. Staff 1 denied grabbing or pushing Youth B. She
further denied using inappropriate language. She said an incident
report was not completed, because it was a playful incident, and
nothing happened to her or the youth. Staff 1 said the facility has
lockers for staff to use, but they don’t have enough for all the staff.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 03/28/2023, in collaboration with
DHHS Specialist. Staff 2 recalls the incident on 03/11/2023 involving
Staff 1 and Youth B. She said Youth B took Staff 1’s purse and Staff
1 went up to Youth B and took the purse back. Staff 2 denied
witnessing Staff 1 grab or push Youth B.
I interviewed Staff 3 at the facility on 04/13/2023, in collaboration with
DHHS Specialist. Staff 3 recalled the incident involving Staff 1 and
Youth B. He said Youth B was being playful and grabbed Staff 1’s
purse. Staff 1 tried to grab the purse and the strap broke. He said
Youth B gave the purse back to Staff 1. Staff 3 denied Staff 1
grabbed or pushed Youth B. He further denied Staff 1 used
inappropriate language with Youth B. He said Youth B and Staff were
both being playful and laughing.
A predisposition conference call held with DHHS Specialist on
04/25/2023 and resulted in no findings.
Video Reviewed:
The video dated 03/11/2023, shows three staff members and two
youths on the wing. Staff 1 is sitting at the desk, Youth B grabs the
purse and walks away, Staff 1 gets up from the desk and grabs
the purse from Youth B, the strap breaks, Staff 1 walks back to the
desk, Youth B tries to hug Staff 1, and Staff 1 puts her hand up
and walks away. Staff 2 is sitting on the sofa with another youth,
and Staff 3 was standing by the doors coming onto the wing
during the incident. The video has no audio.
3

Documentation reviewed as part of this investigation:
Personnel file for Staff 1 -no disciplinary action.
Analysis The facility is not in violation as the video provided by the facility
and interviews with Staff, and Youth confirmed that the staff did
not grab or push youth against the wall and did not use
inappropriate language.
Technical Assistance Provided:
Ensure the facility has enough lockers for staff to use for their
personal belongs.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
